text:
Skewness, or skew, refers to the extent to which a distribution is not symmetrical.
Nonsymmetrical distributions may be either positively or negatively skewed and
result from the occurrence of outliers in the data set. Outliers are observations with
extraordinarily large values, either positive or negative.
A positively skewed distribution is characterized by many outliers in the upper region,
or right tail. A positively skewed distribution is said to be skewed right because of its
relatively long upper (right) tail.
A negatively skewed distribution has a disproportionately large amount of outliers
that fall within its lower (left) tail. A negatively skewed distribution is said to be
skewed left because of its long lower tail.
